graph

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Graph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Graph class represents (directed) graphs, and is thread-safe with the exception of the methods ending with "Unsynchronized" which for performance purposes are not.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      auxiliary nested inner class used to sort the graph's nodes.
      (package private) class  Graph.NodeWeightComparatorUnsynchronized
      faster auxiliary nested inner class used to sort the graph's nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        private Graph(int numnodes,
              int numarcs)
        private Graph constructor, given the number of nodes and the number of arcs that this Graph object will contain.
        Parameters:
        numnodes - int
        numarcs - int

      • Graph

        private Graph(int numnodes,
              int numarcs,
              java.lang.Object[] labels)
        private Graph constructor, taking as arguments the number of nodes, the number of acrs, and an Object array to form the labels of the nodes of this Graph. The labels must have distinct hash-codes so as to serve as keys in a reverse map (from label to node-id), and the labels must have the same length as the numnodes argument.
        Parameters:
        numnodes - int
        numarcs - int
        labels - Object[]

      • Graph

        private Graph(Graph g)
        copy ctor: perform deep copies: each node and graph is copied to new copies so that operations on the new graph or its nodes do not affect the original graph. If the graph's nodes have labels however, being Object instances of unknown class, the new Graph's labels themselves are just refs to the original Graph's labels.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph

    • Method Detail

      • newGraph

        public static Graph newGraph(int numnodes,
                             int numarcs)
        public factory construction method to avoid escaping this in the 2-arg constructor of Graph. The public static factory construction methods are in essence the only methods to construct new Graph objects.
        Parameters:
        numnodes - int
        numarcs - int
        Returns:
        Graph

      • newGraph

        public static Graph newGraph(int numnodes,
                             int numarcs,
                             java.lang.Object[] labels)
        factory construction method to replace calls of the form Graph g = new Graph(numnodes, numarcs, labels), so as to avoid escaping this in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        numnodes - int
        numarcs - int
        labels - Object[] the labels of the nodes of the newly constructed Graph. Notice that the method will fail if the length of this array is not equal to the numnodes argument. The labels must also have distinct hash-codes so that they can serve as keys in the reverse map from label-object to node-id.
        Returns:
        Graph

        factory construction method serving as the copy-constructor for Graph objects. Avoids escaping this in the construction process.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        Returns:
        Graph

      • reverseLinksDirection

        void reverseLinksDirection()
                    throws ParallelException
        reverses the direction of all links in this Graph, so that after calling this method once, the methods Node.getInLinks(), Node.getOutLinks() return respectively the sets Node._outlinks and Node._inlinks, and the methods Link.getStart(),Link.getEnd() return respectively Link._enda and Link._starta.
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • isLinksDirectionReversed

        public boolean isLinksDirectionReversed()

      • addLink

        public void addLink(int starta,
                    int enda,
                    double weight)
             throws GraphException,
                    ParallelException
        add a (directed) link between nodes with id starta and enda.
        Parameters:
        starta - int (in the interval [0, this.getNumNodes()-1])
        enda - int (in the interval [0, this.getNumNodes()-1])
        weight - double
        Throws:
        GraphException - if the addLink(starta,enda) has been called getNumArcs() times already, or if the starta or enda arguments are out-of-bounds or if the arc (starta,enda) has already been added to this Graph
        ParallelException - if the current thread also had the read-lock but there was at least another reader thread in the system

      • existsLink

        public boolean existsLink(int starta,
                          int enda)
                   throws GraphException,
                          ParallelException
        check whether a link exists from starta to enda.
        Parameters:
        starta - int source-node-id
        enda - int end-node-id
        Returns:
        boolean true iff the link exists
        Throws:
        GraphException - if arguments are out-of-bounds
        ParallelException - never throws this exception

      • getShortestPath

        public double getShortestPath(Node s,
                              Node t)
                       throws GraphException
        return the shortest path between Node s and Node t, where the cost of a path is measured in terms of link weights adding up, and all link weights being assumed non-negative. Edges are directed, and the shortest path is one in which all edges are "forward" edges. Essentially this is Dijkstra's label setting method. The method will throw if it finds any negative link weight.
        Parameters:
        s - Node
        t - Node
        Returns:
        double will return Double.MAX_VALUE if there is no path from node s to node t.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s or t is null
        GraphException - if any link weight is negative

      • getAllShortestPaths

        public double[] getAllShortestPaths(Node s)
                             throws GraphException
        return the shortest path costs between Node s and all nodes in this graph, where the cost of a path is measured in terms of link weights adding up, and all link weights are assumed non-negative. Edges are directed, and the shortest path is one in which all edges are "forward" edges. Essentially this is Dijkstra's label setting method. The method will throw if it finds any negative link weight.
        Parameters:
        s - Node
        Returns:
        double[] array whose i-th element is the cost of the shortest path from s to the i-th node. It will return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there is no path from node s to the i-th node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s or t is null
        GraphException - if any link weight is negative

      • getNumComponents

        public int getNumComponents()
                     throws ParallelException
        get the number of independent components of this graph. Uses a cache-based lazy evaluation technique that computes the graph's components on-demand, and is appropriately guarded with this graph's read/write locks.
        Returns:
        int the number of components of this graph.
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if getComponents() has not been invoked yet, the current thread has a read-lock, and another thread has the read-lock on this graph as well.

      • getComponents

        public int[] getComponents()
                    throws ParallelException
        return all maximal connected components of this Graph. The array that is returned is of length _nodes.length and the i-th element has a value from [0...#Components-1] indicating to which component the node belongs.
        Returns:
        int[]
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if this is the first time the method is invoked, the current thread has a read-lock and there is also another thread with a read-lock.

      • getGraphComponents

        public Graph[] getGraphComponents()
                           throws GraphException,
                                  ParallelException
        return all maximal components of this Graph as an array of new Graph objects. Each new graph will have the _nodeLabels array non-null and the label will be an Integer object indicating the node's original node id.
        Returns:
        Graph[]
        Throws:
        GraphException
        ParallelException

      • getComponentCard

        public int getComponentCard(int i)
                     throws ParallelException
        return the number of nodes in max. connected component i i is in the range [0...#comps-1]
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • getDual

        public Graph getDual()
              throws GraphException
        construct and return the dual of this graph. This is accomplished by creating a node in the dual for each arc in this graph, and connecting nodes in the dual that correspond to neighboring arcs in the original. The arcs in the new graph will have unit weight.
        Returns:
        Graph
        Throws:
        GraphException - if there are no edges in this Graph

      • getComplement

        public Graph getComplement()
                    throws GraphException
        get the complement of this (assumed undirected) Graph. The complement of a graph g is a graph with the same nodes as g, but its arc-set is the complement of g's arcs-set in other words, an arc (i,j) (with i < j) is in the complement of g if and only if i and j are not direct neighbors in g. The arcs in the new graph will have unit weight. Any node labels will be shared in the new graph.
        Returns:
        Graph
        Throws:
        GraphException - if this graph is directed: there exists a pair of nodes (i,j) such that both (i,j) and (j,i) are arcs of this Graph.

      • getCliqueLabelSupport

        public double getCliqueLabelSupport(java.util.Set nodes,
                                    Graph g)
                             throws GraphException,
                                    ParallelException
        get the support of a clique of this node in the other Graph g, in terms of their labels. The method compares how many arcs in the clique also appear in the Graph g, when the labels of the endpoints of the two nodes are used.
        Parameters:
        nodes - Set<Integer node_id>
        g - Graph
        Returns:
        double the percentage of arcs from the clique that are also present in the Graph g
        Throws:
        GraphException - if one of the nodes has no labels
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the nodes argument is null or empty
        ParallelException - if the current thread has a write-lock on the Graph object with the largest _id. This is needed to ensure no deadlocks can arise.

      • getAllConnectedLinks

        public java.util.Set getAllConnectedLinks(int k)
                                   throws GraphException
        computes *all* maximal subsets of arcs in this Graph with the property that any two arcs in a set s that is returned are at a distance one from each other. (For k=1 this should be fast enough method)
        Parameters:
        k - int the max. number of hops away any two arcs are allowed to be.
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Set<Integer linkid> >
        Throws:
        GraphException

      • getAllConnectedNodes

        public java.util.Set getAllConnectedNodes(int k)
                                   throws GraphException
        return a Set<Set<Integer nodeId> > that is the set of all sets of nodeids in the result set that have the property that are maximal sets of nodes that are connected with each other with at most 1 hop.
        Parameters:
        k - int
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Set<Integer nodeId> >
        Throws:
        GraphException

      • getAllConnectedBy1Nodes

        public java.util.Set getAllConnectedBy1Nodes(java.lang.Integer maxcount)
                                      throws GraphException
        return the Set<IntSet nodeids> of all sets of nodeids with the property that they are independent (maximal) and at distance at most 2 from each other within the set they are in.
        Parameters:
        maxcount - Integer if not null denotes the max number of 5-cycle based sets of nodes to return
        Returns:
        Set // Set<IntSet nodeids>
        Throws:
        GraphException

      • getAllNborSets

        public java.util.Set getAllNborSets()
        return a Set containing a Set<Integer nodeid> for each node i in this Graph where each Set will comprise the immediate neighbors of node i, plus the node i itself (its id)
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Set<Integer nodeid> >

      • getNborIds

        public java.util.Set getNborIds(java.util.Set nodeids)
                         throws GraphException
        return all node ids of the nodes that are immediate neighbors of any of the nodes whose ids are in the input set argument, excluding the nodes in the input argument set.
        Parameters:
        nodeids - Set // Set<Integer nodeid>
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer nodeid>
        Throws:
        GraphException - if nodeids is null or empty

      • makeNNbors

        public void makeNNbors()
                throws ParallelException
        create a cache of the 2-distance neighbors of each node for faster access.
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • makeNNbors

        public void makeNNbors(boolean force)
                throws ParallelException
        forces the recomputation of the cache holding the 2-distance neighbors of a node if the argument is true. Otherwise, the computation occurs only if the cache is empty.
        Parameters:
        force - boolean
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • makeNbors

        public void makeNbors(boolean force)
               throws ParallelException
        forces the recomputation of the cache holding the 1-distance neighbors of a node if the argument is true. Otherwise, the computation occurs only if the cache is empty.
        Parameters:
        force - boolean
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • getMaxNodeWeight

        public java.lang.Double getMaxNodeWeight(java.lang.String name)
        return the max node weight value of the property with given name. When nodes set their weights, an appropriate cache is updated and is returned in this call via a simple hash-table look-up. Therefore it is a constant time operation.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Double null if the given property name does not have a value for any node in this graph

      • getMaxNodeWeightUnsynchronized

        public java.lang.Double getMaxNodeWeightUnsynchronized(java.lang.String name)
        return the max node weight value of the property with given name. This operation is unsynchronized, and therefore, if used in a multi- threaded context, should be externally synchronized or otherwise provide guarantees that prevent race-conditions from occurring. Otherwise, it is identical to the getMaxNodeWeight(name) method.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Double null if the given property name does not have a value for any node in this graph

      • getMaxNodeWeight

        public java.lang.Double getMaxNodeWeight(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.util.Set forbiddenNodes)
        return the max node weight value of the property with given name among all nodes in this graph EXCEPT those in the forbiddenNodes set. The operation runs in expected constant time in the size of the forbidden set, and linear time in the size of the nodes of the graph.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        forbiddenNodes - Set // Set<Node>
        Returns:
        Double or null if there is no node not in forbiddenNodes

        Returns:
        Vector // Vector<Integer nodeid>

      • updateMaxNodeWeight

        void updateMaxNodeWeight(java.lang.String name,
                         double val)
        updates the max node weight for the given weight name. Only called from Node.setWeight(String, double) and Node.copyWeightsFrom(Node).
        Parameters:
        name - String
        val - double

      • getNodesSortedDescByWeight

        private Node[] getNodesSortedDescByWeight(java.lang.String wname)
        only called from getMaxNodeWeight(name,forbiddennodes), so has already read-lock of this graph.
        Parameters:
        wname - String
        Returns:
        Node[] sorted descending by weight value of the property wname

      • labelComponent

        private int labelComponent(int nid,
                           int c)
                    throws ParallelException
        labels the node with given id and all other nodes reachable by it, with the "label" given by the 2nd argument. Updates the _comps data member.
        Parameters:
        nid - int represents a Node id
        c - int the component to which the node with id nid plus all nodes reachable by it belong to (where reachability is defined without respect for the edges' direction)
        Returns:
        int number of nodes labeled
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • getFullLinkNbors

        private java.util.Set getFullLinkNbors(int lid)
        Parameters:
        lid - int
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Integer linkid>

      • isConnected1

        private boolean isConnected1(java.util.Set nodeids)
                      throws GraphException
        returns true iff each node w/ id in the arg. set, can reach any other node whose id is in the arg set by using at most 1 hop that must also be inside the arg. set.
        Parameters:
        nodeids - Set // Set<Integer nodeid>
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        GraphException - if arg set is empty or null

      • get5CycleBasedConnectedNodes

        private java.util.Set get5CycleBasedConnectedNodes(Link li,
                                                   java.lang.Integer maxsetcount)
                                            throws GraphException
        Parameters:
        li - Link
        maxsetcount - Integer
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Set<Integer nodeid> >
        Throws:
        GraphException

        was used for debugging purposes
        Parameters:
        clique - Collection // Collection<Integer nid>
